intro: Campylostachys phylicoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are linear and often have a grayish or blue-green hue, and it produces pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Campylostachys phylicoides is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
